newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Summer lull cuts Kuwait bourse volume, index up.
newsitem.headline: Summer lull cuts Kuwait bourse volume, index up.

text.p: Kuwait Stock Exchange's (KSE) index rose 19.6 points to 2,418.8 during the week to Wednesday, while trade volume and value eased, affected by the holiday season, dealers said on Thursday.
"It is summer, many investors have started their vacations, but the market is still somewhat active," said Khaled al-Saad, a private investor.
"For the coming few weeks would focus on some shares, some companies are expected to be involved in some lucrative deals," said a portfoilio manager.
Daily average for value of traded shares fell to 42.2 million dinars ($140 million) from 61.6 million. Volume eased to a daily average of 142 million shares from 198.8 million, KSE figures show.
Gainers led losers 29-15, while 26 shares did not move.
Investment firms were the most active sector in terms of traded value with 72.5 million dinars, followed by property firms with 58 million and banks with 34 million.
Only nationals of Gulf Arab states -- Saudi Arabia, Bahrain, United Arab Emirates, Qatar, Oman and Kuwait -- can trade on the exchange. Foreign residents can invest in mutual funds.
